intro: Pimpinella africana, commonly known as African cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which are dispersed by wind. The species is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
